Lab 2¶

BoxWindow¶

class sdia_python.lab2.box_window.BoxWindow(bounds)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a box in any dimension by writing it as a product of segments.

center()[source]¶

Returns a list containing the center of every segment of the box :returns: a list of numbers :rtype: Center type(list)

dimension()[source]¶

Returns the dimension of our box Args : type(int) The dimension of the box

indicator_function(point)[source]¶

Return True if a point is contained in the box

Parameters

point (np.array) – The point to be tested

rand(n=1, rng=None)[source]¶

Generate n points uniformly at random inside the BoxWindow. :param n: [description]. Defaults to 1. :type n: int, optional :param rng: [description]. Defaults to None. :type rng: [type], optional

volume()[source]¶

Computes the volume of our box, by mutliplying the difference between the arguments of every subsegment

class sdia_python.lab2.box_window.UnitBoxWindow(center, dimension)[source]¶

BallWindow¶

class sdia_python.lab2.ball_window.BallWindow(center, radius)[source]¶

Bases: object

class BallWindow contains balls defined by centers and radius

dimension()[source]¶

ball dimensions :returns: dimension :rtype: int

indicator(point)[source]¶

Returns True if a point of interest is inside the ball window. Args :

point : type(float array) : coordinates of the point test.

Returns :

True if the point of interest is inside the ball window

volume()[source]¶

Returns the value of the volume of the ball window Args :

radius : type(float) : the radius of the ball window. center : type(float array) : coordinates of the center of the ball window.

Returns :

volume type(float) : The volume of the ball window.
